definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: It's surrounded on three sides by council housing estates.
sentences.chinese: 它三面都被市建住宅區圍住。

sentences.english: No, though even here, the growers put plastic bags around the bunches to protect them and keep them warm.
sentences.chinese: 不，甚至在這種植者用塑料袋圍住香蕉樹使它們包暖。

sentences.english: After also sent from encirclement of the shaolin temple.
sentences.chinese: 之後還派了兵馬包圍住少林寺。

sentences.english: Thick cotton padding embedded the precious vase in its box.
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的棉花填塞物緊緊圍住裝在盒子中的貴重花瓶。

sentences.english: The celebrated violinist was mobbed by the audience.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆團團圍住了這位著名的小提琴演奏家。

sentences.english: The reactor is surrounded by a light protective shroud and steel plates.
sentences.chinese: 一個淺層的鋼板防護罩圍住了反應堆。

sentences.english: The police arrived as the hoodlums closed in on him.
sentences.chinese: 幾個惡棍逐漸將他團團圍住時，警察到了。

sentences.english: Farmers may want to put up electric fences to inclose enclose grazing areas, called productspaddocks.
sentences.chinese: 牧民可能想要電籬笆以圍住放牧區，這叫圍場。

sentences.english: Have one on the dome row the black clothes person come down and circle Yi snow.
sentences.chinese: 屋頂上就有一排黑衣人下來，圍住伊雪。

sentences.english: Packed in wooden cases iron hooped at both ends .
sentences.chinese: 木箱裝，兩端用鐵箍圍住。

sentences.english: Then he sent a unit to surround Longli southeast of Guiyang .
sentences.chinese: 於是他派遺了一支部隊去圍住貴陽東南的龍里。

sentences.english: She muffled her throat with a scarf.
They glassed in the open porch.
sentences.chinese: 他們將門廊用玻璃圍住。
